reviews.review_msg: She's a very nice lady who can be hard to understand at times, however, all you need is explained in the powerpoints, so as long as you study those well, everything should be fine.

As a person, she was very nice and eager to help out and answer questions. However, class was a joke. I BSed literally the whole course and got an A+. She sends out the ppt, and you can get all the info from the textbook too (which I found easier to understand than her.) Pop quizzes and assignments were extremely easy, just know basic stuff to pass

She's a very nice lady who can be hard to understand at times, however, her quizzes/tests are very closely related to what is taught in the lecture so just make sure you understand the powerpoint slides.

She does her best to explain concepts. She might be confusing at first, but I got used to the way she explained things.She's very fair.I disagree with the comment below in that if you want to do get in A/A+ range you MUST attend lectures.However some of the stuff is common sense so you could definitely BS and still pass the course.I'd recommend her

She genuinely wants you to do well, and tries very hard to help. It's just sometimes hard to understand her... And as some of the previous comments stated, for questions on quizzes and tests, you just BS as much as you can and try to relate it to the topic. You really don't even need to go to lecture...

Extremely nice! gives u multiple chances to do well in course.Really wants u 2 learn concepts so she lets rewrites 4 quizes. Assignmts r easy marks. U'll do well on quizes if you study. Text is fine for clarifying things, but stick to her notes! midterm n final both fair. mt more challenging. she does have an accent. I strongly recommend her!!!

Worst professor I've had so far. Not only is there a language barrier, she does not reply to E-mails, reads off lecture slides and is NEVER available for extra help. She is nice and humble, but not a very good prof overall.

Worst prof I've seen so far. Yes, she's warm and helpful. However, because of her teaching skill and strong accent, you'll have lots of questions. You can't clear all your confusion :(. At other notes, her teaching skill is horrible! She doesn't even give review material if you don't ask! Her note's a mess and imagine the combination of all this.

Rada was probably the nicest and most helpful prof I had this semester. Her lectures are a hit and miss, but are usually really helpful. She always answers questions and is good at explaining a confusing topic. Definitely recommend her!

Highly recommend taking PSYC221 first and saving your science credit for this, the class is a breeze with the prior knowledge from 221- so much overlap. Her slides were strangely formatted and all over the place regarding content. She was also impossible to reach, my friends and I probably sent a total of 15 emails and never got anything back.

I struggled with the course content because I was talking Cogs 100 as B-Sci course. Dr. Grant's teaching style didn't necessarily match my personal learning style therefore I struggled in the class, but she was suuuper helpful when I attended her office hours and did everything to help as I didn't feel confident that I would pass (I did).

Dr Grant is so nice but her lectures feel very disorienting. The material she presents in lectures is hard to piece together since she makes them feel like different topics rather than ideas that intertwine (lectures don't make the connections between topics and ideas clear nor engaging).
